A96010501-d-01-05-96-EARY.Narrative: ON JANUARY 5, 1996, CSX TRANSPORTATION TRAIN A73505 HAD MORE CARS TO DELIVER TO EARY AT BEMISTON INTERCHANGE. THEY HAD TEN CARS LEFT OVER AND TRIED TO PUT THE CARS ON THE SOUTH LEG OF THE TALLADEGA WYE AND DERAILED. THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS WDDE GAGE JUST PAST THE SWITCH. CSXT THOUGHT THAT EARY WAS MAINTAINING THE TRACK. AS FAR AS I CAN TELL THE TRACK HAD NOT BEEN MAINTAINED BY EITHER RAILROAD FOR ABOUT 4 YEARS. MAINTENANCE AGREEMENTS HAVE BEEN FOUND AND THEY SHOW THAT EARY IS RESPONSIBLEFRR THE MAINTENANCE AND THE TRACKAGE HAS BEEN REPAIRED TO CLASS 1 REQUIREMENTS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

AS HE APPROACHED THE CROSSING HE SAW& HEARD THE WHISTLE & APPROACHING TRAIN. HE ATTEMPTED TO STOP HIS RIG, HOWEVER, WHEN HE APPLIED THEBRAKES HE WENT INTO A SKID. AS HE APPROACHED THE CROSSING IN THE SKID HE JUMPED FROM THE TRUCK.THE CAB OF THE SEMIWENT ONTO THE CROSSING & WAS STRUCK BY THE LEAD UNIT OF TRAIN 613. THE SEMI CAB WAS DEMOLISHED. THE LEAD ENGINE SUSTAINED DAMAGES. NEITHER THE CREW NOR THE DRIVER WERE INJURED.THE TRAINSTOPPED 20 CARS PAST THE CROSSING. THE DRIVER DID INDICATE HE HEARD THE TRAIN WHISTLE & SAW THE TRAIN AS HE APPROACHED THE CROSSING. HE HAD 167 FEET OF SKID MARKS ON THE ICE ACCORDING TO THE INVESTIGATING SHERIFF. NO CITATIONS WERE ISSUED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

11796-d-01-17-96-ME.Primary Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track

11796-d-01-17-96-ME.Narrative: MORRISTOWN & ERIE TRAIN #50/51 WAS PROCEEDING EAST ON THE WHIPPANY LINE THROUGH EAST HANOVER APPROACHING THE PASSAIC RIVER BRIDGE. ENGINES #18 & 17 WERE SHOVING THE 4 CAR CONSIST EASTWARD TO SWITCH ROSELAND MFG. (POLANER). UPON REACHING THE PRIVATE UTILITY CROSSING APPROX. 500' WEST OF PASSAIC RIVERTHE NORTH SIDE WHEEL OF 1ST AXLE OF EASTWARD TRUCK OF CAR #ADMX17293 WAS LIFTED FROM RAIL APPARENTLY BY ICE IN FLANGEWAY OF CROSSING. THIS CAUSED LEAD TRUCK TO DERAIL SHIFTING THE CAR ABRUPTLY IN A NORTH DIRECTION. DUE TO CONTOUR OF EMBANKMENT THE CAR TIPPED & ROLLED OVER 180 DEGREES & SLID DOWN EMBANKMENT. COUPLER ACTION CAUSED CAR ACFX73122 TO TIP & FOLLOW LEAD CAR OFF THE RAILS IN A NORTH DIRECTION & PART WAY DOWN EMBANKMENT, REMAINED UPRIGHT & CAME TO REST AGAINST LEAD CAR. THE REMAINING 2CARS & ENGINES #18 & 17 REMAINED ON THE RAILS. BOTH CONDUCTOR & BRAKMAN NOTICED START OF DERAILMENT& IMMEDIATELY TOOK STEPS TO LIMIT PROGRESSION. ENGINEER SET BRAKES TO "EMERGENCY STOP" HOWEVER WEIGHT OF DERAILED CARS CARRIED TRAIN AN ADDITIONAL 120 FT. IT WAS NOTED THERE WERE NO INJURIES OR FATALITIES TO EMPLOYEES OR CIVILIANS & NO DAMAGE TO CIVIL., MUNIC., OR UTIL. PROPERTY.NoneNoneNone

960118-d-01-18-96-MCR.Narrative: TRAIN WAS ON MAIN TRACK BETWEEN MCCLOUD & MT. SHASTA YARD. TRAIN PASTTHROUGH THE SWITCH BACK & WAS IN REVERSE MOVEMENT DOWN A 4% GRADE HEADED WEST TO MT. SHASTA YARD IN HEAVY SNOW CONDITIONS. TRAIN WITH 2 UNITS WITH DYNAMIC BRAKING SLIPPED OUT OF DYNAMIC BRAKING ON ICY RAILS. APPLICATION OF TRAIN AIR BRAKES WAS INEFFECTIVE & ADDITIONAL APPLICATION WAS ALSO INEFFECTIVE. TRAIN THEN PUT INTO EMERGENCY WITH APPARENTLY NO EFFECT. INDEPENDENT BRAKES OF 2 UNITS WERE APPARENTLY THE ONLY BRAKING FORCE FOR THE TRAIN & LEFT THE RAIL AT A 15 DEGREE CURVE AT 37 MPH. EXAMINATION FOR CAUSE OF INEFFECTIVE AIRBRAKE OPERATION WAS HAMPERED BY A HEAVY SNOW STORM THAT CONTINUED FOR SEVERAL DAYS BEYOND DERAILMENT & BY NEED TO MOVE DERAILED CARS TO REPAIR TRACKAGE. AN AIR TEST WAS DONE PRIOR TO DEPARTURE IN MCCLOUD & USE OF AIR WHISTLE ON CABOOSE (LEADING CAR) SEVERAL MILES BEFORE EMERGENCY APPLICATION INDICATE AIR IN TRAIN APPEARED OPERATIVE. SNOW BANKS ON EITHER SIDE OF TRAIN EXISTED HAVE BEEN KNOWN TO CAUSE LEAKAGE BY HITTING RETAINER VALVES. WOODCHIP CARS THATNoneNoneNoneNone
